item.title: UK economy surprises with stronger-than-expected 0.3% growth in November
item.description: Economists expect the U.K. economy to improve in 2026, particularly as the Bank of England is likely to continue on its interest rate-cutting path.

item.title: A major development in Trump's Fed feud is set to happen next week in the Supreme Court
item.description: Supreme Court arguments on Jan. 21 will likely be the next big development for the central bank's quest to maintain independence.

item.title: Wholesale inflation was softer than expected, retail sales moved higher in November
item.description: Wholesale prices moved up less than expected while consumers kept up a heavy buying pace, according to economic data Wednesday.

item.title: China's annual trade surplus hits a record $1.2 trillion, even as exports to U.S. decline by 20%
item.description: China's exports growth in December sharply beat expectations, catapulting the annual trade surplus to a record high.

item.title: December core consumer prices rose at a 2.6% annual rate, less than expected
item.description: Excluding volatile food and energy prices, the consumer price index showed a seasonally adjusted 0.2% gain on a monthly basis and 2.6% annually.
